channel.title: Translation on RIDDL Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Translation on RIDDL Documentation

item.title: riddlc options
item.author: reid@reactific.com (Reid Spencer)
item.description: Introduction Like many other complex programs, riddlc implements a variety of commands, each with their own functionality and their own options. As there are overlaps Options come and go as riddlc evolves. If you experience issues with the command line options, you can always run riddlc without any options and it will explain the options your version supports. Common Options Some options are common to all the commands. -h (–help) Causes riddlc to print out help and usage information and exit.

item.title: Hugo Docs
item.author: reid@reactific.com (Reid Spencer)
item.description: One of the main features of the RIDDL compiler is generating HTML documentation. The documentation enjoys the advantage of being more complete and accurate due to the compiler’s rigorous analyses. The riddlc compiler generates Hugosources for conversion to a web-site by the hugo generator. See Hugo Documentation for details on how to
